text: The 2014–15 Korisliiga was the 75th season of the highest professional basketball tier in Finland. The league champion qualified for the 2015–16 Eurocup regular season.ECA Shareholders Meeting sets new season and future plans. Euroleague. Kataja won its first title in franchise history. ==Teams== Eleven teams participated in the Korisliiga this season. Lappeenrannan NMKY left the league because of its poor economic situation. ===Budgets=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Team !Budgets2014–15 Korisliiga team budgets at basket.fi !Change from last year |- |Bisons Loimaa || 820,000 € || align="center" | – 30,000 € |- |Joensuun Kataja || 675,000 € || align="center" | –50,000 € |- |Helsinki Seagulls || 630,000 € || align="center" | Second division |- |Kouvot || 520,000 € || align="center" | + 135,000 € |- |Kauhajoen Karhu || 520,000 € || align="center" | - 65,000 € |- |KTP || 500,000 € || align="center" | - 50,000 € |- |Tampereen Pyrintö || 404,000 € || align="center" | + 75,000 € |- |Tapiolan Honka || 396,000 € || align="center" | + 29,000 € |- |Namika Lahti || 385,000 € || align="center" | + 55,000 € |- |Salon Vilpas || 350,000 € || align="center" | ± 0 € |- |Korikobrat || 300,000 € || align="center" | - 10,000 € |} ==Regular season== === Rounds 1-20 === === Rounds 21-40 === ==Playoffs== ==Awards== {| class="wikitable" |- !
